itemDescription: Welsh rugby union and rugby league footballer

wikipedia_page.main: Isaac "Ike" John Fowler (27 August 1894 – 17 June 1981) was a Welsh dual-code international rugby union, and professional rugby league footballer who played in the 1910s and 1920s. He played representative level rugby union (RU) for Wales, and at club level for Ammanford RFC and Llanelli RFC, as a scrum-half, and representative level rugby league (RL) for Wales, and the Other Nationalities, and at club level for Batley (vice-captain), as a scrum-half.

response: *17 June - Ike Fowler, dual-code international rugby union player, 86
*27 August – Ike Fowler, dual-code international rugby union player (died 1981)
